org.hypknowsys.wumprep4weka.filters
Class WUMprepFilter

java.lang.Object
  weka.filters.Filter
      org.hypknowsys.wumprep4weka.filters.WUMprepFilter
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, weka.gui.beans.LogWriter
Direct Known Subclasses:
WUMprepConfigurableFilter, WUMprepFilterTest
public abstract class WUMprepFilter
extends weka.filters.Filter
implements weka.gui.beans.LogWriter, java.io.Serializable

Abstract base class for creating filter adapters to WUMprep Perl scripts. For each WUMprep Perl script that should be available from the Weka environment, a specialized wrapper class has to be written that inherits from this. The primary purpose of this specialized class is to parameterize WUMprepWrapper. As practically all neccessary services are already implemented in WUMprepWrapper, the code for a wrapper for "WUMprep4WekaTest.pl" reduces to these few lines of code: 

 package org.hypknowsys.wumprep4weka.filters;
 
 public class WUMprepFilterTest extends WUMprepFilter {
 
        public WUMprepFilterTest() {
                super();
                m_args = "";
                m_wumprepScript = "WUMprep4WekaTest.pl";
        }
 }
In general, derived classes must just overwrite m_wumprepScript and m_args, which are the file name of the WUMprep Perl script relative to the WUMprep "src" directory and the String with the command line arguments to be passed to the script.

Version:

Carsten Pohle (cp AT cpohle de)

Constant Field Values

m_args

protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> m_args
The arguments to be passed to the script as a HashMap. The keys of the HashMap are the argument 'names' (e.g., "-c"), the HashMap's values are the values of the arguments (e.g. "somePath/wumprep.conf").

input

public boolean input(weka.core.Instance instance)
Input an instance for filtering. Ordinarily the instance is processed and made available for output immediately. Some filters require all instances be read before producing output.

Overrides:
input in class weka.filters.Filter
Parameters:
instance - The input instance
Returns:
True if the filtered instance may now be collected with output().
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - If no input format has been defined.
